channel.title: Bug Reports - SMR Forums
channel.description: Topics in the 'Bug Reports' category A mod has a bug? Report it here.

item.title: SMART Mod doesn't work with truck stations
item.dc:creator: @Christopher_R Christopher R
item.description:
@Christopher_R wrote:

Was attempting to lay out a row of stations and it wasn’t responsive to the smart mod key commands. I changed to building smelters just to verify if the mod was working right, and that worked correctly, but stations not so much.

Posts: 1

Participants: 1

Read full topic
item.source: SMART Mod doesn't work with truck stations

item.title: Fluid AWESOME Sink - Game crash
item.dc:creator: @ZviHantsis Zvi Hantsis
item.description:
@ZviHantsis wrote:

Hi!

So lately I had issues with Fluid AWESOME Sink mod crashing the game on startup (after splash, not getting to main menu). I have eliminated all other options and it is only due to the Fluid AWESOME Sink mod.
It doesn’t seem to be related to some other mod (inter-mod compatibility), but just problematic on it’s own.

I’ve got a crash report but couldn’t attach it here.

Posts: 2

Participants: 1

Read full topic

item.title: Smart Mod wall placing bug - Update 5
item.dc:creator: @suppokettu Suppokettu
item.description:
@suppokettu wrote:

Hi

Not sure if I’m only one having this, but there seems to be issue with placing walls after update 5.

If I place for example 5 walls vertically one by one and next to that place 5 walls vertically using Smart Mod (scrolling mouse wheel), there is small cap/height difference of these 5 walls. It looks like spacing is little off, when using Smart Mod. Same happens also placing walls horizontally.

Added screenshot that probably explains issue better.

20211202175337_13440×1440 806 KB

Posts: 4

Participants: 3

Read full topic

crash report is in the link below.
UE4 - crash report

Can this be solved?

item.title: Installing Satisfactory Mod Manager gives Javascript error
item.dc:creator: @Tommy_Tytgat Tommy
item.description:
@Tommy_Tytgat wrote:

Hi there. I have recently started playing Satisfactory and I was trying to install the Satisfactory Mod Manager off the home page of ficsit.app and ran into a little problem… This is the very first time that I am trying to install mods and or mod managers onto Satisfactory and after an hour or so of googling and youtube-ing I still haven’t found any forum or video related to my issue.

This is the error that I get, without the Mod Manager actually opening. I just installed it (for the 5 billionth time) again and this is what I get when I click finish when the ‘launch Satisfactory Mod Manager’ checkbox is checked:

I hope someone can help…

These were the steps I took after downloading the latest Mod Manager from the homepage link:

  • List item Opened Mod Manager ‘.exe’ file as admin
  • List item Selected ‘anyone who uses this computer’ option
  • List item Left folder as it was (same disk as Steam directory for Satisfactory)
  • List item Hit ‘Install’
  • List item Hit ‘Finish’ with checkbox ‘Run Satisfactory Mod Manager’ checked

After this the error shows up, same for any version of the manager I try to install.

Posts: 1

Participants: 1

Read full topic
item.source: Installing Satisfactory Mod Manager gives Javascript error

item.title: Feedback for Smart Mod
item.dc:creator: @What_About_me What About Me
item.description:
@What_About_me wrote:

Hello,

Just started using the Smart Mod. Find it to be a real time saver. But two things I have found and given I am new to using this mod it may just be something I am doing wrong, but here’s what I have found, When Creating Splitters in a row joined by some Conveyer Belt I found it worked well on the flat surface but when placing on top of an existing run of splitters it would Indicate it was encroaching others clearance. the other one was with the solar panels it seems to overlap the edges which is certainly nice for the extra power the extra row would give on a long run but when placing the manually it is not possible to overlap the edge it also did not run the power to them at all.

Otherwise if you are starting a new factory it works like a dream.

As I indicated in the topic header this is only feedback. But I hope to see this mod grow more and more

Posts: 1

Participants: 1

Read full topic

item.title: Infinity Dynamic Inventory Slot - Rss disappearing
item.dc:creator: @Nick_Simmons Nick Simmons
item.description:
@Nick_Simmons wrote:

Good Evening,

My partner is using the above mod along with a number of other mods (80+, crazy I know), and every time that she dies, reloads, or opens the game up again, the items that were in the new slots created by this mod have completely disappeared. I can imagine that the new slots do not stay and have to be respawned each time that you load the game but I was wondering if anyone else had the same issue and if the Dev was aware of the issue?

Happy building

Posts: 5

Participants: 3

Read full topic
item.source: Infinity Dynamic Inventory Slot - Rss disappearing

item.title: Structural Solutions - Issue
item.dc:creator: @Frank_Coon Frank Coon
item.description:
@Frank_Coon wrote:

Mike Skinner / D4rkL0rd -
Great mod, looks very nice. There is an issue with your objects overlapping. When using the 8x8x1 block if you are targeting an existing block the game/nod will allow you to place another block over the existing one. This creates and issue when spam placing blocks where you end up with 2+ block in every space depending on where the targeting is when you are clicking as you run. Looks like the collision is not set up right to keep the objects from occupying the same space the way official foundations work.

Thanks!

Posts: 2

Participants: 2

Read full topic

item.title: Refined Power bug: nuclear waste duplication
item.dc:creator: @maudib2222 Maudib2222
item.description:
@maudib2222 wrote:

(maybe a bug?)
running latest version on experimental

The nuclear heaters accept nuclear waste as an input, and return to you 10x what was put in.
Just for giggles I put in 10 nuclear waste barrels, and immediately the machine spat out 100 barrels of waste, with no effect. Nudge for purex?

just curious: is it normal that the heaters produce 10 barrels of waste (at full heat) per nuclear fuel rod consumed?

Posts: 2

Participants: 2

Read full topic
item.source: Refined Power bug: nuclear waste duplication
